ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:0.5_0: 24. The training rule on worldly gain
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.2_0: On one occasion the senior monks who instructed the nuns were instructing the nuns to receive robes, almsfood, dwellings, and medicines.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.3_0: And the monks from the group of six said this about them,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.4_0: “The senior monks aren’t instructing the nuns to render a service, but for the sake of worldly gain.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.5_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.6_0: “How can the monks from the group of six say that
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.7_0: ‘The senior monks aren’t instructing the nuns to render a service, but for the senior monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.7_1: The senior monks are instructing the nuns to instruct the nuns.” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.8_0: “Is it true, monks, that you say this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.9_0: the senior monks aren’t instructing the nuns to render a service, but for the sake of worldly gain?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.12_0: “... Foolish men, how can you say that
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.13_0: the senior monks aren’t instructing the nuns to render a service, but for the sake of worldly gain?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.14_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.15_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:1.16.1_0: ‘If a monk says that the senior monks are instructing the nuns for the sake of worldly gain, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.1.2_0: and you have the same kind of perception ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.1.4_0: ... The monks who have been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.1.5_0: For the sake of worldly gain:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.1.6_0: for the sake of robes, for the sake of almsfood, for the sake of a dwelling, for the sake of medicines, for the sake of honor, for the sake of respect, for the sake of deference, for the sake of veneration, for the sake of worship.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.1.8_0: if, concerning one who is fully ordained and who has been agreed upon by the Sangha as an instructor of nuns—desiring
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.1_0: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, and he says such a thing, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.2_0: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, and he says such a thing, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.3_0: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as illegitimate, and he says such a thing, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.4_0: When someone who is fully ordained is an instructor of nuns, but he has not been agreed upon by the Sangha as such, and a monk—desiring to disparage him, desiring to give him a bad reputation, desiring to humiliate him—says,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.5_0: “He instructs for the sake of robes,” “... for the sake of almsfood,” “... for the sake of a dwelling,” “... for the sake of medicines,” “... for the sake of honor,” “... for the sake of respect,” “... for the sake of deference,” “... for the sake of veneration,” “... for the sake of worship,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.6_0: When someone who is not fully ordained is an instructor of nuns, whether or not he has been agreed upon by the Sangha as such, and a monk—desiring to disparage him, desiring to give him a bad reputation, desiring to humiliate him—says,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.7_0: “He instructs for the sake of robes,” “... for the sake of almsfood,” “... for the sake of a dwelling,” “... for the sake of medicines,” “... for the sake of honor,” “... for the sake of respect,” “... for the sake of deference,” “... for the sake of veneration,” “... for the sake of worship,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.8_0: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but they perceive it as legitimate, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.9_0: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but they is unsure of it, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.2.10_0: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and they perceive it as such, they commit an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.3.2_0: if he regularly gives the instruction for the sake of robes, ... for the sake of almsfood, ... for the sake of a dwelling, ... for the sake of medicines, ... for the sake of honor, ... for the sake of respect, ... for the sake of deference, ... for the sake of veneration, ... for the sake of worship;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc24:2.3.5_0: The fourth rule, the training rule on worldly gain, is finished.
